title: Why won't Barclays let us move our mortgage?
text:

Fri, Sep 11, 2015, 19:40 BST - UK Markets closed Why won't Barclays let us move our mortgage? By Jessica Gorst-Williams | Telegraph – 5 hours ago 4.389 +0.629 
A frustrated 60-something couple, both with good jobs, are flummoxed over Barclays (LSE: BARC.L - news ) ' decisions over their borrowing 
I am 67, semi-retired and self-employed. My wife, aged 64, has a good job. 
We took out a portable interest-only mortgage in September 2008 for 10 years with Barclays. With house prices buoyant we now wish to sell our current property, worth £360,000, and pay Barclays (Swiss: BARC.SW - news ) £125,000. 
Then we wish to move the remaining £50,000 of the mortgage to a smaller house. 
However, the Barclays adviser tells me that I do not fit into any of its mortgage contract or lending criteria for a new mortgage. 
It (Other OTC: ITGL - news ) does not seem to understand that this is not a new mortgage. The adviser then offered my wife a six-year repayment mortgage of £50,000 at about £750 a month. 
We explained that we did not want another mortgage. PG, bucks 
When I contacted Barclays it transpired that, following a recent review of its mortgage procedures and criteria, a new process had been introduced on June 25 for existing customers who apply for a like-for-like transfer of their mortgage. 
This includes situations where there is no increase in the borrowing or the term, and where all parties to the mortgage remain unchanged. 
This means it can review your proposition again. A mortgage adviser is contacting you to discuss this further.
